©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
During an audit of a small organization that provides medical transcription services, an information systems
(IS) auditor observes several issues related to the backup and restore process. Which of the following should
be the auditor's GREATEST concern?

options.A:
Restoration testing for backup media is not performed; however, all data restore requests have been
successful.
options.B:
The policy for data backup and retention has not been reviewed by the business owner fbr the past three
years.
options.C:
The organization stores transcription backup media offsite using a third-party service provider that
inventories backups annually.
options.D: Failed backup alerts fbr the marketing department data files are not followed up on or resolved by the IT

justifications.A:
Lack of restoration testing does not increase the risk of unauthorized leakage of information. Not
performing restoration tests on backup media poses a risk; however, this risk is somewhat mitigated
because past data restore requests have been successful.
justifications.B:
Lack of review of the data backup and retention policy may be a concern if systems and business
processes have changed in the past three years. The information systems (IS) auditor should perform
additional procedures to verify the validity of existing procedures. In addition, lack of this control does
not introduce a risk of unauthorized leakage of information.
justifications.C:
Losing a backup medium is a major incident for an organization handling confidential patient
data. Privacy laws impose severe penalties, and mandated reporting requirements can harm the
organization^ reputation. To ensure proper backup handling, the organization should conduct
audit tests, including frequent physical inventories and evaluating controls at the third-party
provider
justifications.D:
Failed backup alerts that are not followed up on and resolved imply that certain data or files are not
backed up. This is a concern if the files/data being backed up are critical in nature, but, typically,
marketing data files are not regulated in the same way as medical transcription files. Lack of this control
does not introduce a risk of unauthorized leakage of sensitive information.

questions.question: Determining the service delivery objective (SDO) should be based PRIMARILY on:

options.A: the minimum acceptable operational capability.
options.B: the cost-effectiveness of the restoration process.
options.C: meeting the recovery time objectives (RTOs).
options.D: the allowable interruption window.

justifications.A:
The service delivery objective (SDO) is the level of service to be reached during the alternate
process mode until the normal situation is restored. This is directly related to the business needs.
justifications.B: The cost-effectiveness of the restoration process is not the main consideration of determining the SDO.
justifications.C:
Meeting the recovery time objective (RTO) may be one of the considerations in determining the SDO, but
it is a secondary factor.
justifications.D:
The allowable interruption window may be one of the factors secondary to determining the SDO.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor reviewing the application change management process fbr a large
multinational organization should be MOST concerned when:

options.A: test systems run different configurations than production systems.
options.B: change management records are paper based.
options.C: the configuration management database is not maintained.
options.D: the test environment is installed on the production server.

justifications.A:
Although, ideally, production and test systems should be configured identically, there may be reasons why
this does not occur. The more significant concern is whether the configuration management database was
not maintained.
justifications.B:
Paper-based change management records are inefficient to maintain and not easy to review in large
volumes; however, they do not present a concern from a control point of view if they are properly and
diligently maintained.
justifications.C:
The configuration management database (CMDB) is used to track configuration item (CI) and the
dependencies between them. An out-of-date CMDB in a large multinational organization can result
in incorrect approvals being obtained or leave out critical dependencies during the test phase.
justifications.D:
Although it is not ideal to have the test environment installed on the production server, it is not a
control-related concern. If the test and production environments are kept separate, they can be installed on
the same physical server(s).

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor can verify that an organization's business continuity plan (BCP) is
effective by reviewing the:

options.A: alignment of the BCP with industry good practices.
options.B: results of business continuity tests performed by information systems (IS) and end-user personnel.
options.C: offsite facility, its contents, security and environmental controls.
options.D: annual financial cost of the BCP activities versus the expected benefit of the implementation of the plan.

justifications.A:

assurance of the effectiveness of the BCP.
justifications.B:
The effectiveness of the BCP can best be evaluated by reviewing the results from previous business
continuity tests fbr thoroughness and accuracy in accomplishing their stated objeetives.
justifications.C:
The offsite facility, its contents, security and environmental controls do not provide assurance of the
effectiveness of the BCP. Only testing will provide an accurate assessment of the effectiveness of the
BCP.
justifications.D:
The annual financial cost of the BCP activities versus the expected benefit of implementation of the
plan does not provide assurance of the effectiveness of the BCP. Only testing will provide an accurate
assessment of the effectiveness of the BCP.

questions.question: It is MOST appropriate to implement an incremental backup scheme when:

options.A: there is limited recovery time for critical data.
options.B: online disk-based media are preferred.
options.C: there is limited media capacity.
options.D: a random selection of backup sets is required.

justifications.A: A full backup or differential backup is preferred in this situation.
justifications.B: Incremental backup could be used irrespective of the media adopted.
justifications.C:
In an incremental backup, after the full backup, only the files that have changed are backed up,
thus minimizing media storage.
justifications.D:
A random selection of backup sets may not be possible with an incremental backup scheme because only
fragments of the data are backed up on a daily basis.

questions.question:
Which of the following BEST mitigates the risk arising from using reciprocal agreements as a recovery
alternative?

options.A: Perform disaster recovery exercises annually.
options.B: Ensure that partnering organizations are separated geographically.
options.C: Regularly perform a business impact analysis (BIA).
options.D: Select a partnering organization with similar systems.

justifications.A:
Although disaster recovery exercises are important but difficult to perform in a reciprocal agreement, the
greater risk is geographic proximity.
justifications.B:
If the two partnering organizations are in close geographic proximity, this can lead to both
organizations being subjected to the same environmental disaster, such as an earthquake.
justifications.C:
A business impact analysis (BIA) will help both organizations identify critical applications, but separation
is a more important consideration when entering reciprocal agreements.
justifications.D:
Selecting a partnering organization with similar systems is a good idea, but separation is a more important
consideration when entering reciprocal agreements.

questions.question:
During the review of an in-house developed application, the GREATEST concern to an information systems
(IS) auditor is if a:

options.A: user raises a change request and tests it in the test environment.
options.B: programmer codes a change in the development environment and tests it in the test environment.
options.C: manager approves a change request and then reviews it in production.
options.D: manager initiates a change request and subsequently approves it.

justifications.A: Having a user involved in testing changes is common practice.
justifications.B:
Having a programmer code a change in development and then separately test the change in a test
environment is a good practice and preferable over testing in production.
justifications.C: Having a manager review a change to make sure it was done correctly is an acceptable practice.
justifications.D:
Initiating and approving a change request by the same person violates the principle of separation of
duties, because one should not approve their own requests.

questions.question:
In a disaster recovery situation, which of the following is the MOST important metric to ensure that data are
synchronized between critical systems?

options.A: recovery point objective (RPO)
options.B: recovery time objective (RTO)
options.C: recovery service resilience
options.D: recovery service scalability

justifications.A:
Establishing a common recovery point objective (RPO) is most critical fbr ensuring that
interdependencies between systems are properly synchronized. It ensures that systems do not
contain data from different points in time that may result in accounting transactions that cannot be
reconciled and a loss of referential integrity.
justifications.B:
recovery time objectives (RTOs) are not as important to synchronize because they normally vary
depending on the level of effort and resources required to restore a system.
justifications.C:
Recovery service resilience measures the fault tolerance due to data exceptions and ability to restart and
recover from internal failures.
justifications.D:
Recovery service scalability refers to the capacity constraints and limitations that a recovery solution may
have relative to the original system configuration.
334 CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13比 Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
Which of the following BEST mitigates the risk of backup media containing irreplaceable information being
lost or stolen while in transit?

options.A: Ensure that media are encrypted.
options.B: Maintain a duplicate copy.
options.C: Maintain chain of custody.
options.D: Ensure that personnel are bonded.

justifications.A: Although strong encryption protects against disclosure, it will not mitigate the loss of irreplaceable data.
justifications.B:
Sensitive data should always be fully backed up before being transmitted or moved. Backups of
sensitive information should be treated with the same control considerations as the actual data.
justifications.C:
Chain of custody is an important control, but it will not mitigate a loss if a locked area is broken into and
media removed or if media are lost while in an individuaFs custody.
justifications.D: Bonded security, although good fbr preventing theft, will not protect against accidental loss or destruction.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is reviewing the change management process fbr an enterprise resource
planning application. Which of the following is the BEST method for testing program changes?

options.A: Select a sample of change tickets and review them for authorization.
options.B: Perform a walk-through by tracing a program change from start to finish.
options.C: Trace a sample of modified programs to support change tickets.
options.D: Use query software to analyze all change tickets for missing fields.

justifications.A:
Selecting a sample of change tickets and reviewing them fbr authorization helps test fbr authorization
controls; however, it does not identify program changes that were made without supporting change
tickets.
justifications.B:
Performing a walk-through assists the information systems (IS) auditor in understanding the process but
does not ensure that all changes adhere to the normal process.
justifications.C:
Tracing modified programs to change tickets is the best way to test change management controls
and detect undocumented changes.
justifications.D:
Using query software to analyze all change tickets fbr missing fields does not identify program changes
that were made without supporting change tickets.

questions.question: Emergency changes that bypass the normal change control process are MOST acceptable if:

options.A: management reviews and approves the changes after they have occurred.
options.B: the changes are reviewed by a peer at the time of the change.
options.C: the changes are documented in the change control system by the operations department.
options.D: management has preapproved all emergency changes.

justifications.A:
Because management cannot always be available when a system failure occurs, it is acceptable for
changes to be reviewed and approved within a reasonable time period after they occur.
justifications.B:
Although peer review provides some accountability, management should review and approve all changes,
even if that review and approval must occur after the fact.
justifications.C: Documenting the event does not replace the need fbr a review and approval process to occur.
justifications.D:
It is not a good control practice fbr management to ignore its responsibility by preapproving all
emergency changes in advance without reviewing them. Unauthorized changes can then be made without
management knowledge.

questions.question:
To optimize an organization's business continuity plan, an information systems (IS) auditor should
recommend a business impact analysis to determine:

options.A:
the business processes that generate the most financial value for the organization and, therefore, must be
recovered first.
options.B: the priorities and order for recovery to ensure alignment with the organization's business strategy.
options.C: the business processes that must be recovered following a disaster to ensure the organization's survival.
options.D: the priorities and order of recovery, which will recover the greatest number of systems in the shortest time

justifications.A:
It is a common mistake to overemphasize financial value rather than urgency. For example, although
the processing of incoming mortgage loan payments is important from a financial perspective, it can be
delayed fbr a few days in the event of a disaster. Wiring funds to close on a loan, although not generating
direct revenue, is far more critical because of the possibility of regulatory problems, customer complaints
and reputation issues.
justifications.B: The business strategy (which is often a long-term view) does not have a direct impact at this point in time.
justifications.C:
To ensure the organization^ survival following a disastei; it is important to recover the most critical
business processes first.
justifications.D:
The mere number of recovered systems does not have a direct impact at this point in time. The important
action is to recover systems that would impact business survival.

©ISACA, All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
Which of the following is the MOST efficient strategy for the backup of large quantities of mission-critical
data when the systems need to be online to take sales orders 24 hours a day?

options.A: Implementing a fault-tolerant disk-to-disk backup solution.
options.B: Making a full backup weekly and an incremental backup nightly.
options.C: Creating a duplicate storage area network (SAN) and replicating the data to a second SAN.
options.D: Creating identical server and storage infrastructure at a hot site.

justifications.A:
Disk-to-disk backup involves writing the primary backup to disk instead of tape. This allows for
later copying, cloning or migration to tape. It ensures minimal system performance impact, enables
fast backups of large data volumes and offers immediate transfer to an alternate disk set in case of
failure.
justifications.B:
Although a backup strategy is valid, because many computer systems must be taken offline so that
backups can be performed, there is the need to create a backup window, typically during each night. This
does not enable the system to be available 24/
justifications.C: No explanation available
justifications.D: No explanation available

questions.question:
Which of the following BEST ensures uninterrupted operations in an organization with IT operation centers in
several countries?

options.A: Distribution of key procedural documentation
options.B: Reciprocal agreement between business partners
options.C: Strong senior management leadership
options.D: Employee training on the BCP

justifications.A:
Procedural documentation should always be up-to-date and distributed to major locations. However,
documents alone are insufficient if employees do not know their role in the plan.
justifications.B:
A reciprocal agreement is an emergency processing agreement between two or more enterprises with
similar equipment or applications. Typically, participants of a reciprocal agreement promise to provide
processing time to each other when an emergency arises. Although it is integral to business continuity
to have a location fbr business operations, it does not necessarily need to be a reciprocal agreement. For
example, in some cases, business operations may be carried out from each employee's home.
justifications.C:
Senior management may not be readily available to provide leadership during a disaster. Therefore, it is
most important that employees fully understand their roles in the business continuity plan (BCP).
justifications.D:
During a disaster, the chain of command might be interrupted. Therefore, it is important that
employees know their roles in the BCP, including where to report and how to perform their job
functions. Employee training on the plan is especially important for businesses with offices that are
geographically separated because there is a greater chance of communication disruption.
337
CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
Which of the following BEST ensures that users have uninterrupted access to a critical, heavily used
web-based application?

options.A: Disk mirroring
options.B: redundant array of inexpensive disks (RAID)
options.C: Dynamic domain name system (DNS)
options.D: Load balancing

justifications.A:
Disk mirroring provides real-time replication of disk drives but does not ensure uninterrupted system
availability in the event a server crashes.
justifications.B:
redundant array of inexpensive disks (RAID) technology improves resiliency but does not protect against
failure of a network interface card or central processing unit processor failure.
justifications.C:
Dynamic domain name system (DNS) is a method used to assign a host name to an Internet Protocol
address that is dynamic. This is a useful technology but does not help ensure availability.
justifications.D:
Load balancing distributes traffic across multiple servers, ensuring uninterrupted system
availability and consistent response time for web applications. It also redirects traffic to functional
servers if a server fails.

questions.question: Which of the following is the BEST method to ensure that critical IT system failures do not reoccur?

options.A: Invest in redundant systems.
options.B: Conduct a follow-up audit.
options.C: Monitor system performance.
options.D: Perform root cause analysis.

justifications.A:
Redundancy may be a solution; however, a root cause analysis enables an educated decision to address
the origin of the problem instead of simply assuming that system redundancy is the solution.
justifications.B:
Although an audit may discover the root cause of the problem, an audit is not a solution to an operational
problem. Identifying the origins of operational failures needs to be part of day-to-day IT processes and
owned by the IT department.
justifications.C:
Monitoring tools are a means to gather data and can contribute to root cause analysis, but they alone do
not help prevent an existing problem from recurring.
justifications.D:
Root cause analysis determines the key reason an incident has occurred and allows for appropriate
corrections that will help prevent the incident from recurring.
338 C/SA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
Which of the following is MOST important when an operating system (OS) patch is to be applied to a
production environment?

options.A: Successful regression testing by the developer
options.B: Approval from the information asset owner
options.C: Approval from the security officer
options.D: Patch installation at alternate sites

justifications.A:
Although testing is important for any patch, in this case, it should be assumed that the operating
system (OS) vendor tested the patch before releasing it. Before this OS patch is put into production,
the organization should do system testing to ensure that no issues will occur.
justifications.B:
It is most important that information owners approve any changes to production systems to ensure
that no serious business disruption takes place as the result of the patch release.
justifications.C: The security officer does not normally need to approve every OS patch.
justifications.D:
Security patches need to be deployed consistently across the organization, including alternate sites.
However, approval from the information asset owner is still the most important consideration.

questions.question:
The information systems (IS) auditor observes that the latest security-related software patches fbr a mission-
critical system were released two months ago, but IT personnel have not yet installed the patches. The IS
auditor should:

options.A: review the patch management policy and determine the risk associated with this condition.
options.B: recommend that IT systems personnel test and then install the patches immediately.
options.C: recommend that patches be applied every month or immediately upon release.
options.D: take no action, because the IT processes related to patch management appear to be adequate.

justifications.A:
Reviewing the patch management policy and determining whether the IT department is compliant
with the policies will detect whether the policies are appropriate and what risk is associated with
current practices.
justifications.B:
Although there may be instances in which the patch is an urgent fix for a serious security issue, IT may
have made the determination that the risk to system stability is greater than the risk identified by the
software vendor who issued the patch. Therefore, the time frame selected by IT may be appropriate.
justifications.C:
Although keeping critical systems properly patched helps to ensure that they are secure, the requirement
for a precise timetable to patch systems may create other issues if patches are improperly tested prior to
implementation. Therefore, this is not the correct answer.
justifications.D:
Even if the information systems (IS) auditor concludes that the patch management process is adequate,
the observation related to the time delay in applying patches should be reported.
339
CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST helps prioritize the recovery of IT assets when planning fbr a disaster?

options.A: Incident response plan
options.B: Business impact analysis (BIA)
options.C: Threat and risk analysis
options.D: Recovery time objective (RTO)

justifications.A:
An incident response plan is an organized approach to addressing and managing a security breach or
attack. The plan defines what constitutes an incident and the process to follow when an incident occurs. It
does not prioritize recovery during a disaster.
justifications.B:
Incorporating the business impact analysis (BIA) into the IT disaster recovery planning process is
critical to ensure that IT assets are prioritized to align with the business.
justifications.C:
Identifying threats and analyzing risk to the business is an important part of disaster planning, but it does
not determine the priority of recovery.
justifications.D:
The recovery time objective (RTO) is the amount of time allowed for the recovery of a business function
or resource after a disaster occurs. This is included as part of the BIA and used to represent the
prioritization of recovery.

questions.question:
Which of the following is the MOST likely reason an organization implements an emergency change to an
application using the emergency change control process?

options.A: The application owner requested new functionality.
options.B: Changes are developed using an agile methodology.
options.C: There is a high probability of a significant impact on operations.
options.D: The operating system vendor has released a security patch.

justifications.A:
Requests for new functionality by the application owner generally follow normal change control
procedures, unless they have an impact on the business function.
justifications.B:
The agile system development methodology breaks down projects into short time-boxed iterations. Each
iteration focuses on developing end-to-end functionality from user interface to data storage fbr the
intended architecture. However, the release does not need to follow emergency release procedures unless
there is a significant impact on operations.
justifications.C:
Emergency releases are urgent fixes that are implemented to prevent significant user downtime,
following specific procedures.
justifications.D:
Operating system security patches are applied after testing, and, therefore, there is no need for an
emergency release.
340 CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manuall3th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
An organization with a limited budget has a recovery time objective (RTO) of 72 hours and a recovery point
objective (RPO) of 24 hours. Which of the following would BEST meet the requirements of the business?

options.A: Hot site
options.B: Cold site
options.C: Mirrored site
options.D: Warm site

justifications.A:
Although a hot site enables the business to meet its recovery point objective (RPO) and recovery time
objective (RTO), the cost to maintain a hot site is more than the cost to maintain a warm site, which can
also meet the objectives.
justifications.B:
A cold site, although providing basic infrastructure, lacks the required hardware to meet the business
objectives.
justifications.C:
A mirrored site provides fully redundant facilities with real-time data replication. It can meet the business
objectives, but it is not as cost-effective a solution as a warm site.
justifications.D:
A warm site is a suitable solution because it provides essential infrastructure and most of the
required IT equipment at a reasonable cost. Additional equipment can be obtained through vendor
agreements within days.

questions.question:
Which of the following is MOST important to determine the recovery point objective (RPO) fbr a critical
process in an enterprise?

options.A: Number of hours of acceptable downtime
options.B: Total cost of recovering critical systems
options.C: Extent of data loss that is acceptable
options.D: Acceptable reduction in the level of service

justifications.A:
The recovery time objective (RTO) is the amount of time allowed for the recovery of a business function
or resource after a disaster.
justifications.B: The determination of the recovery point objective (RPO) already takes cost into consideration.
justifications.C:
The RPO determines acceptable data loss and the earliest acceptable recovery point in time,
quantifying the permissible data loss in case of interruption.
justifications.D:
The service delivery objective (SDO) is directly related to the business needs. The SDO is the level of
services to be reached during the alternate process mode until the normal situation is restored.

CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is assisting in the design of the emergency change control procedures
for an organization with a limited budget. Which of the following recommendations BEST helps to establish
accountability fbr the system support personnel?

options.A: Production access is granted to the individual support ID when needed.
options.B: Developers use a firefighter ID to promote code to production.
options.C: A dedicated user promotes emergency changes to production.
options.D: Emergency changes are authorized prior to promotion.

justifications.A:
Production access should be controlled and monitored to ensure separation of duties. During an
emergency change, a user who normally does not have access to production may require access.
The best process to ensure accountability within the production system is to have the information
security team create a production support group and add the user ID to that group to promote the
change. When the change is complete the ID can be removed from the group. This process ensures
that activity in production is linked to the specific ID that was used to make the change.
justifications.B:
Some organizations may use a firefighter ID, which is a generic/shared ID, to promote changes to
production. When needed, the developer can use this ID to access production. It may still be difficult
to determine who made the change; therefore, although this process is commonly used, the use of a
production support ID is a better choice.
justifications.C:
Having a dedicated user who promotes changes to production in an emergency is ideal but is generally not
cost-effective and may not be realistic for emergency changes.
justifications.D:
Emergency changes are, by definition, unauthorized changes. Approvals usually are obtained following
promotion of the change to production. All changes should be auditable, and that can best be
accomplished by having a user ID added/removed to the production support group as needed.

questions.question: Segmenting a highly sensitive database results in:

options.A: reduced exposure.
options.B: reduced threat.
options.C: less criticality.
options.D: less sensitivity.

justifications.A: Segmenting data reduces the quantity of data exposed to a particular vulnerability.
justifications.B:
The threat may remain constant, but each segment represents a different vector against which it must be
directed.
justifications.C: Criticality is a data attribute and is not affected by the manner in which it is segmented.
justifications.D:
Sensitivity is a data attribute and is not affected by the manner in which it is segmented.
342 CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
Which of the following is the BEST way to ensure that incident response activities are consistent with the
requirements of business continuity?

options.A: Draft and publish a clear practice for enterprise-level incident response.
options.B: Establish a cross-departmental working group to share perspectives.
options.C: Develop a scenario and perform a structured walk-through.
options.D: Develop a project plan for end-to-end testing of disaster recovery.

justifications.A:
Publishing an enterprise-level incident response plan is effective only if business continuity aligned itself
to incident response. Incident response supports business continuity, not the other way around.
justifications.B:
Sharing perspectives is valuable, but a working group does not necessarily lead to ensuring that the
interface between plans is workable.
justifications.C:
A structured walk-through including both incident response and business continuity personnel
provides the best opportunity to identify gaps or misalignments between the plans.
justifications.D:
A project plan developed for disaster recovery does not necessarily address deficiencies in business
continuity or incident response.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is evaluating network performance for an organization that is considering
increasing its Internet bandwidth due to a performance degradation during business hours. Which of the
following is MOST likely the cause of the performance degradation?

options.A: Malware on servers
options.B: Firewall misconfiguration
options.C: Increased spam received by the email server
options.D: Unauthorized network activities

justifications.A:
The existence of malware on the organization's server can contribute to network performance issues, but
the degraded performance would not likely be restricted to business hours.
justifications.B:
Firewall misconfiguration can contribute to network performance issues, but the degraded performance
would not likely be restricted to business hours.
justifications.C:
The existence of spam on the organization's email server can contribute to network performance issues,
but the degraded performance would not likely be restricted to business hours.
justifications.D:
Unauthorized network activities—such as employee use of file or music sharing sites, online
gambling or personal email containing large files or photos—can contribute to network
performance issues. Because the information systems (IS) auditor found the degraded performance
during business hours, this is the most likely cause.

questions.question:
Which of the following is the BEST method fbr an information systems (IS) auditor to verify that critical
production servers are running the latest security updates released by the vendor?

options.A: Ensure that automatic updates are enabled on critical production servers.
options.B: Verify manually that the patches are applied on a sample of production servers.
options.C: Review the change management log for critical production servers.
options.D: Run an automated tool to verify the security patches on production servers.

justifications.A:
Ensuring that automatic updates are enabled on production servers may be a valid way to manage
the patching process; however, this does not provide assurance that all servers are being patched
appropriately.
justifications.B:
Verifying patches manually on a sample of production servers is less effective than automated testing and
introduces a significant audit risk. Manual testing is also difficult and time consuming.
justifications.C:
The change management log may not be updated on time and may not accurately reflect the patch update
status on servers. A better testing strategy is to test the server for patches, rather than examining the
change management log.
justifications.D:
An automated tool can immediately provide a report on which patches have been applied and
which are missing.

questions.question:
Which of the following choices BEST ensures accountability when updating data directly in a production
database?

options.A: Review of audit logs
options.B: Principle of least privilege
options.C: Approved validation plan
options.D: Separation of duties

justifications.A:
Detailed audit logs that contain the user ID of the individual who performed the change and the
data before and after the change are the best evidence of database changes. A review of these logs
identifies the individual who changed the data (ensuring accountability) and the correctness of the
change.
justifications.B:
Although access to production databases should be controlled by the principle of least privilege, this does
not identify who made the change or indicate if the change was made correctly.
justifications.C:
Having an approved validation plan indicates that the change was made correctly but does not show who
made the change in production. Only a system-generated audit log can prove accountability.
justifications.D:
Separation of duties only ensures that the user making the data change is different than the individual who
approved the data change. It does not identify the individual who made the change, nor does it ensure that
the data change was correct.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor has discovered that a new patch is available for an application, but the IT
department has decided that the patch is not needed because other security controls are in place. What should
the IS auditor recommend?

options.A: Apply the patch only after it has been thoroughly tested.
options.B: Implement a host-based intrusion detection system (IDS).
options.C: Modify the firewall rules to further protect the application server.
options.D: Assess the overall risk, then recommend whether to deploy the patch.

justifications.A:
Applying a patch without first performing a risk assessment might be a waste of resources if it is
determined that the application is not mission critical.
justifications.B:
Implementing a host-based intrusion detection system (IDS) is a valid control; however, it may not
address vulnerabilities within the application.
justifications.C:
Modifying the firewall rules may help to mitigate the risk of a security incident; however, first, the risk
related to the patch needs to be determined.
justifications.D:
Although it is important to ensure that systems are properly patched, a risk assessment needs
to be performed to determine the likelihood and probability of the vulnerability being exploited.
Therefore, the patch is applied only if the risk of circumventing the existing security controls is
great enough to warrant it.
345
CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is reviewing the most recent disaster recovery plan of an organization.
Which approval is the MOST important when determining the availability of system resources required for
the plan?

options.A: Executive management
options.B: IT management
options.C: Board of directors
options.D: Steering committee

justifications.A:
Although executive management9s approval is essential, the IT department is responsible fbr managing
system resources and their availability as related to disaster recovery (DR).
justifications.B:
Because a disaster recovery plan (DRP) is based on the recovery and provisioning of IT services, IT
management's approval is most important to verify that the system resources will be available in
the event that a disaster event is triggered.
justifications.C:
The board of directors may review and approve the DRP, but the IT department is responsible fbr
managing system resources and their availability as related to DR.
justifications.D:
The steering committee determines the requirements for DR (recovery time objective and recovery point
objective); however, the IT department is responsible fbr managing system resources and their availability
as related to DR.

questions.question:
Which of the following inputs would PRIMARILY help in designing the data backup strategy in case of
potential natural disasters?

options.A: Recovery point objective (RPO)
options.B: Volume of data to be backed up
options.C: Available data backup technologies
options.D: Recovery time objective (RTO)

justifications.A:
The recovery point objective (RPO) determines acceptable data loss and the earliest recovery point
in time, quantifying the acceptable data loss in case of interruption for designing backup strategies.
justifications.B:
Although the amount of data to be stored is critical in terms of planning fbr adequate capacity, the speed
of recovery required by the business is the most important factor.
justifications.C:
Although a solid understanding of the capabilities of all types of advanced data backup technologies
is necessary, without the knowledge of the RPO, one cannot design a backup strategy using these
technologies.
justifications.D:
The recovery time objective (RTO) is the amount of time allowed for the recovery of a business function
or resource after a disaster occurs. This helps in designing disaster site options, but not the data backup
strategy in the case of impacting disasters.
346 CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
While conducting an audit on the customer relationship management application, the information systems (IS)
auditor observes that it takes a significantly long time fbr users to log on to the system during peak business
hours as compared with other times of the day. After a user is logged on, the average response time fbr the
system is within acceptable limits. Which of the following choices should the IS auditor recommend?

options.A: No action should be taken because the system meets cunent business requirements.
options.B: IT should increase the network bandwidth to improve performance.
options.C: Users should be provided with detailed manuals to use the system properly.
options.D: Establish performance measurement criteria for the authentication servers.

justifications.A:
The information systems (IS) auditor should not recommend taking no action, because a delayed login
process has a negative impact on employee productivity.
justifications.B:
Network bandwidth may or may not be the root cause of this issue. Performance measurement criteria
may help determine the cause, which can then be remediated.
justifications.C:
Because the problem is related to logging on and not to processing, additional training for users is not
effective in this case.
justifications.D:
Performance criteria for the authentication servers would help to quantify acceptable thresholds
for system performance, which can be measured and remediated.

questions.question:
Due to resource constraints, a developer requires full access to production data to support certain problems
reported by production users. Which of the following choices is a good compensating control for controlling
unauthorized changes in production?

options.A: Provide and monitor separate developer login IDs for programming and fbr production support.
options.B: Capture activities of the developer in the production environment by enabling detailed audit trails.
options.C: Back up all affected records before allowing the developer to make production changes.
options.D: Ensure that all changes are approved by the change manager prior to implementation.

justifications.A:
Providing separate login IDs that only allow a developer privileged access when required is a good
compensating control, but it must also be backed up with monitoring and supervision of the activity
of the developer
justifications.B:
Although capturing activities of the developer via audit trails or logs is a good practice, the control is not
effective unless these audit trails are reviewed on a periodic basis.
justifications.C:
Creating a backup of affected records before making the change allows fbr rollback in case of an error but
does not prevent or detect unauthorized changes.
justifications.D:
Even though changes are approved by the change manager, a developer with full access can easily
circumvent this control.

questions.question: Which of the following choices would MOST likely ensure that a disaster recovery effort is successful?

options.A: The tabletop test was performed.
options.B: Data restoration was completed.
options.C: Recovery procedures are approved.
options.D: Appropriate staff resources are committed.

justifications.A:
Performing a tabletop test is extremely helpful but does not ensure that the recovery process is working
properly.
justifications.B:
The most reliable method to determine whether a backup is valid is to restore it to a system. A data
restore test should be performed at least annually to verify that the process is working properly.
justifications.C: Approved recovery procedures do not ensure that data can be successfully restored.
justifications.D:
Although having appropriate staff resources is appropriate, without data, the recovery will not be
successful.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is auditing an IT disaster recovery plan (DRP). The IS auditor should
PRIMARILY ensure that the plan covers:

options.A: a resilient IT infrastructure.
options.B: alternate site information.
options.C: documented disaster recovery test results.
options.D: analysis and prioritization of business functions.

justifications.A:
A resilient IT infrastructure is typically required to minimize interruptions to IT services; however, if a
critical business function does not require high availability of IT, this may not be required fbr all disaster
recovery plan (DRP) elements.
justifications.B:
Although the selection of an alternate site is important, the more critical issue is the prioritization of
resources based on impact and recovery time objective (RTO) of business functions.
justifications.C:
Documented DRP test results are helpful when maintaining the DRP; however, the DRP must first and
foremost be aligned with business requirements.
justifications.D:
The DRP must primarily fbcus on recovering critical business functions in the event of disaster
within predefined RTOs; thus, it is necessary to align the recovery of IT services based on the
criticality of business functions.
348 CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor observed that users are occasionally granted the authority to change
system data. This elevated system access yet is required fbr smooth functioning of business operations. Which
of the following controls does the IS auditor MOST likely recommend for long-term resolution?

options.A: Redesign the controls related to data authorization.
options.B: Implement additional separation of duties controls.
options.C: Review policy to see if a formal exception process is required.
options.D: Implement additional logging controls.

justifications.A:
Data authorization controls should be driven by the policy. Although there may be some technical
controls that can be adjusted, if the data changes happen infrequently, then an exception process is the
better choice.
justifications.B:
Although adequate separation of duties is important, the information systems (IS) auditor must first
review policy to see if there is a formal documented process fbr this type of temporary access controls to
enforce separation of duties.
justifications.C:
If the users are granted access to change data in support of the business requirements, the policy
should be followed. If there is no policy for the granting of extraordinary access, then one should be
designed to ensure that no unauthorized changes are made.
justifications.D:
Audit trails are needed whenever temporary elevated access is required. However, this is not the first step
the auditor should take in reviewing the overall process.

questions.question:
A medium-sized organization, whose IT disaster recovery measures have been in place and regularly tested
fbr years, has just developed a formal business continuity plan (BCP). A basic BCP tabletop exercise has been
performed successfully. Which testing should an information systems (IS) auditor recommend be performed
next to verify the adequacy of the new BCP?

options.A: Full-scale test with relocation of all departments, including IT, to the contingency site.
options.B: Walk-through test of a series of predefined scenarios with all critical personnel involved.
options.C: IT disaster recovery test with business departments involved in testing the critical applications.
options.D: Functional test of a scenario with limited IT involvement.

justifications.A:
A full-scale test in the situation described might fail because it would be the first time that the plan is
actually exercised, and a number of resources (including IT) and time would be wasted.
justifications.B:
The walk-through test is a basic type of testing. Its intention is to make key staff familiar with the plan
and discuss critical plan elements, rather than verifying its adequacy.
justifications.C:
The recovery of applications should always be verified and approved by the business instead of being
purely IT-driven. The IT plan has been tested repeatedly so a disaster recovery test would not help in
verifying the administrative and organizational parts of the business continuity plan (BCP), which are not
IT-related.
justifications.D:
After a tabletop exercise has been performed, the next step is a functional test, which includes
the mobilization of staff to exercise the administrative and organizational functions of a recovery.
Because the IT part of the recovery has been tested fbr years, it is more efficient to verify and
optimize the BCP before actually involving IT in a full-scale test. The full-scale test would be the
last step of the verification process before entering into a regular annual testing schedule.
349

©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
Which of the following business continuity plan (BCP) tests involves participation of relevant members of the
crisis management/response team to practice proper coordination?

options.A: Tabletop
options.B: Functional
options.C: Full-scale
options.D: Desk check

justifications.A:
The primary purpose of tabletop testing is to practice proper coordination because it involves all
or some of the crisis team members and is focused more on coordination and communication issues
than on technical process details.
justifications.B:
Functional testing involves mobilization of personnel and resources at various geographic sites. This is a
more in-depth functional test and not primarily focused on coordination and communication.
justifications.C:
A full-scale test is a comprehensive and realistic simulation of a disaster scenario, involving multiple
teams and resources. It aims to test the entire business continuity plan (BCP) in a real-world environment.
Although coordination among various teams is essential in a full-scale test, it does not specifically
mention the participation of the crisis management/response team or emphasize practicing proper
coordination.
justifications.D:
A desk check is a review and analysis of the BCP documents by individuals or a small group. It is
typically a more passive and theoretical exercise, involving the review of plans, policies and procedures
without active participation or coordination among team members.

questions.question:
Which of the following is the BEST method to ensure that the business continuity plan (BCP) remains up to
date?

options.A: The group walks through the different scenarios of the plan from beginning to end.
options.B: The group ensures that specific systems can actually perform adequately at the alternate offsite facility.
options.C: The group is aware of full-interruption test procedures.
options.D: Interdepartmental communication is promoted to better respond in the case of a disaster.

justifications.A:
A structured walk-through test gathers representatives from each department who will review the
plan and identify weaknesses.
justifications.B:
The ability of the group to ensure that specific systems can actually perform adequately at the alternate
offsite facility is a parallel test and does not involve group meetings.
justifications.C:
Group awareness of full-interruption test procedures is the most intrusive test to regular operations and
the business.
justifications.D:
Although improving communication is important, it is not the most valued method to ensure that the plan
is up to date.
350 CISA @ Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
An organization with a number of offices across a wide geographical area has developed a disaster recovery
plan (DRP). Using actual resources, which of the following is the MOST cost-effective test of the DRP?

options.A: Full operational test
options.B: Preparedness test
options.C: Paper test
options.D: Regression test

justifications.A: A full operational test is conducted after the paper and preparedness test and is quite expensive.
justifications.B:
A preparedness test offers a more practical approach by assessing the readiness of actual resources
and systems. It provides a higher level of confidence that the organization's critical components are
prepared for recovery without incurring the potential disruptions and costs associated with a full
operational test
justifications.C:
A paper test is a structured walk-through of the disaster recovery plan (DRP) and should be conducted
before a preparedness test, but a paper test (desk check) is not sufficient to test the viability of the plan.
justifications.D: A regression test is not a DRP test and is used in software development and maintenance.

questions.question: The organization's disaster recovery plan (DRP) should address early recovery of:

options.A: all information systems processes.
options.B: all financial processing applications.
options.C: only those applications designated by the information systems (IS) manager.
options.D: processing in priority order, as defined by business management.

justifications.A: A disaster recovery plan (DRP) recovers most-critical systems first, according to business priorities.
justifications.B: Depending on business priorities, financial systems may or may not be the first to be recovered.
justifications.C:
The business manager, not the information systems (IS) manager, determines priorities fbr system
recovery.
justifications.D:
Business management should know which systems are critical and what they need to process well in
advance of a disaster. It is managements responsibility to develop and maintain the plan. Adequate
time will not be available for this determination after the disaster occurs. IS and the information
processing facility are service organizations that exist for the purpose of assisting the general user
management in successfully performing their jobs.
351
CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question: Which of the following must exist to ensure the viability of a duplicate information processing facility (IPF)?

options.A: The site is near the primary site to ensure quick and efficient recovery.
options.B: The site contains the most advanced hardware available.
options.C: The workload of the primary site is monitored to ensure adequate backup is available.
options.D: The hardware is tested when it is installed to ensure it is working properly.

justifications.A:
The site chosen should not be subject to the same natural disaster as the primary site. Being close may be
a risk or an advantage, depending on the type of expected disaster.
justifications.B:
A reasonable compatibility of hard ware/soft ware must exist to serve as a basis fbr backup. The latest or
newest hardware may not adequately serve this need.
justifications.C:
Resource availability must be assured. The workload of the primary site must be monitored to
ensure that availability at the alternate site fbr emergency backup use is sufficient.
justifications.D:
Testing the hardware when the site is established is essential, but regular testing of the actual backup data
is necessary to ensure that the operation will continue to perform as planned.

questions.question: Which of the following tasks should be performed FIRST when preparing a disaster recovery plan (DRP)?

options.A: Develop a recovery strategy.
options.B: Perform a business impact analysis (BIA).
options.C: Map software systems, hardware and network components.
options.D: Appoint recovery teams with defined personnel, roles and hierarchy.

justifications.A: Developing a recovery strategy will come after performing a business impact analysis (BIA).
justifications.B: The first step in any disaster recovery plan (DRP) is to perform a BIA.
justifications.C:
The BIA identifies critical business processes and the systems that support those processes. Mapping
software systems, hardware and network components will come after performing a BIA.
justifications.D:
Appointing recovery teams with defined personnel, roles and hierarchy will come after performing a BIA.
352 C/SA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
After completing the business impact analysis (BIA), what is the NEXT step in the business continuity
planning process?

options.A: Test and maintain the plan.
options.B: Develop a specific plan.
options.C: Develop recovery strategies.
options.D: Implement the plan.

justifications.A:
After selecting a strategy, a specific business continuity plan (BCP) can be developed, tested and
implemented.
justifications.B: After selecting a strategy, a specific BCP can be developed, tested and implemented.
justifications.C:
After the business impact analysis (BIA) is completed, the next phase in the BCP development is to
identify the various recovery strategies and select the most appropriate strategy for recovering from
a disaster that will meet the timelines and priorities defined through the BIA.
justifications.D: After selecting a strategy, a specific BCP can be developed, tested and implemented.

questions.question: Which of the following is an appropriate test method to apply to a business continuity plan (BCP)?

options.A: Pilot
options.B: Paper
options.C: Unit
options.D: System

justifications.A:
A pilot test is used fbr implementing a new process or technology and is not appropriate for a business
continuity plan (BCP).
justifications.B:
A paper test (sometimes called a desk check) is appropriate for testing a BCP. It is a walk-through
of the entire BCP, or part of the BCP, involving major players in the BCP's execution who
determine what may happen in a particular disaster.
justifications.C: A unit test is used to test new software components and is not appropriate fbr a BCP.
justifications.D:
A system test is an integrated test used to test a new IT system but is not appropriate fbr a BCP.
353
C/SA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
As part of the business continuity planning process, which of the following should be identified FIRST in the
business impact analysis (BIA)?

options.A: Risk, such as single point-of^failure and infrastructure risk
options.B: Threats to critical business processes
options.C: Critical business processes fbr ascertaining the priority fbr recovery
options.D: Resources required fbr resumption of business

justifications.A: Risk should be identified after the critical business processes have been identified.
justifications.B:
The identification of threats to critical business processes can only be determined after the critical
business processes have been identified.
justifications.C:
The identification of critical business processes should be addressed first so that the priorities and
timelines for recovery can be documented.
justifications.D:
Identification of resources required fbr business resumption occur after the identification of critical
business processes.

questions.question: Which of the following contributes MOST to an effective business continuity plan (BCP)?

options.A: The document is circulated to all interested parties.
options.B: Planning involves all user departments.
options.C: The plan is approved by senior management.
options.D: An audit is performed by an external information systems (IS) auditor.

justifications.A:
The business continuity plan (BCP) circulation ensures that the BCP document is received by all users.
Although essential, this does not contribute significantly to the success of the BCP.
justifications.B:
The involvement of user departments in the BCP is crucial fbr the identification of the business
processing priorities and the development of an effective plan.
justifications.C: A BCP approved by senior management does not necessarily ensure the effectiveness of the BCP.
justifications.D:
An audit does not necessarily improve the quality of the BCP.

©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
Depending on the complexity of an organization's business continuity plan (BCP), it may be developed as a
set of plans to address various aspects of business continuity and disaster recovery. In such an environment, it
is essential that:

options.A: each plan is consistent with one another.
options.B: all plans are integrated into a single plan.
options.C: each plan is dependent on one another.
options.D: the sequence fbr implementation of all plans is defined.

justifications.A:
Depending on the complexity of an organization, there can be more than one plan to address
various aspects of business continuity and disaster recovery, but the plans must be consistent to be
effective.
justifications.B: The plans do not necessarily have to be integrated into one single plan.
justifications.C:
Although each plan may be independent, each plan must be consistent with other plans to have a viable
business continuity planning strategy.
justifications.D:
It may not be possible to define a sequence in which plans have to be implemented because it may be
dependent on the nature of disaster, criticality, recovery time, etc.
355
CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
When developing a business continuity plan (BCP), which of the following tools should be used to gain an
understanding of the organization's business processes?

options.A: Business continuity self-audit
options.B: Resource recovery analysis
options.C: Risk assessment
options.D: Gap analysis

justifications.A:
Business continuity self-audit is a tool for evaluating the adequacy of the business continuity plan (BCP)
but not for gaining an understanding of the business.
justifications.B:
Resource recovery analysis is a tool fbr identifying the components necessary fbr a business resumption
strategy but not for gaining an understanding of the business.
justifications.C:
Risk assessment and business impact assessment are tools for understanding the business as a part
of a BCP.
justifications.D:
The role that gap analysis can play in a BCP is to identify deficiencies in a plan but not to gain an
understanding of the business.

questions.question:
Which of the following should be of MOST concern to an information systems (IS) auditor reviewing the
business continuity plan (BCP)?

options.A: The disaster levels are based on scopes of damaged functions but not on duration.
options.B: The difference between low-level disaster and software incidents is not clear.
options.C: The overall BCP is documented, but detailed recovery steps are not specified.
options.D: The responsibility fbr declaring a disaster is not identified.

justifications.A:
Although failure to consider duration can be a problem, it is not as significant as scope, and neither is as
critical as the need to identify someone with the authority to invoke the business continuity plan (BCP).
justifications.B:
The difference between incidents and low-level disasters is always unclear and frequently revolves around
the amount of time required to correct the damage.
justifications.C:
The lack of detailed steps should be documented, but their absence does not mean a lack of recovery if
someone has invoked the BCP.
justifications.D:
If nobody declares the disaster the BCP is not invoked, making all other concerns less important.
356 CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
During an audit of a business continuity plan (BCP), an information systems (IS) auditor found that, although
all departments were housed in the same building, each department had a separate BCP. The IS auditor
recommended that the BCPs be reconciled. Which of the following areas should be reconciled FIRST?

options.A: Evacuation plan
options.B: Recovery priorities
options.C: Backup storages
options.D: Call tree

justifications.A:
Protecting human resources during a disaster-related event should be addressed first. Having
separate business continuity plans (BCPs) can result in conflicting evacuation plans, thus
jeopardizing the safety of staff and clients.
justifications.B:
Recovery priorities may be unique to each department and can be addressed separately, but still should be
reviewed for possible conflicts and/or the possibility of cost reduction, but only after the issue of human
safety has been analyzed.
justifications.C:
Backup strategies are not critical to the integration of the plans fbr the various departments. Life safety is
always the first priority.
justifications.D:
Communication during a crisis is always a challenge, but the call tree is not as important as ensuring life
safety first.

questions.question:
For effective implementation after a business continuity plan (BCP) has been developed, it is MOST
important that the BCP be:

options.A: stored in a secure offsite facility.
options.B: approved by senior management.
options.C: communicated to appropriate personnel.
options.D: made available through the enterprise's intranet.

justifications.A:
If the business continuity plan (BCP) is kept in a safe place, it will not reach the users, users will never
implement the BCP and, thus, the BCP will be ineffective.
justifications.B:
Senior management approval is a prerequisite fbr designing and approving the BCP but is less important
than making sure that the plan is available to all key personnel to ensure that the plan will be effective.
justifications.C:
The implementation of a BCP will be effective only if appropriate personnel are informed and
aware of all the aspects of the BCP.
justifications.D:
Making a BCP available on an enterprise's intranet does not guarantee that personnel will be able to
access, read or understand it.
357
CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question: Which of the following is the PRIMARY objective of the business continuity plan (BCP) process?

options.A: To provide assurance to stakeholders that business operations will continue in the event of disaster.
options.B: To establish an alternate site for IT services to meet predefined recovery time objectives (RTOs).
options.C: To manage risk while recovering from an event that adversely affected operations.
options.D: To meet the regulatory compliance requirements in the event of natural disaster.

justifications.A:
The business continuity plan (BCP) does not provide assurance of continuing operations; however, it
helps the organization to respond to disruptions to critical business processes.
justifications.B: Establishment of an alternate site is more relevant to disaster recovery than the BCP.
justifications.C:
The BCP process primarily focuses on managing and mitigating risk during recovery of operations
due to an event that affected operations.
justifications.D:
The regulatory compliance requirements may help establish the recovery time objective (RTO)
requirements.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST helps to detect errors in data processing?

options.A: Programmed edit checks
options.B: Well-designed data entry screens
options.C: Separation of duties
options.D: Hash totals

justifications.A: Automated controls, such as programmed edit checks, are preventive controls.
justifications.B: Automated controls, such as well-designed data entry screens, are preventive controls.
justifications.C:
Enforcing separation of duties primarily ensures that a single individual does not have the authority to
both create and approve a transaction; this is not considered to be a method to detect errors, but a method
to help prevent errors.
justifications.D:
The use of hash totals is an effective method to reliably detect errors in data processing. A hash
total indicates an error in data integrity.
358 CIS A ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question: Which of the following is the MOST critical to the quality of data in a data warehouse?

options.A: Accuracy of the source data
options.B: Credibility of the data source
options.C: Accuracy of the extraction process
options.D: Accuracy of the data transformation

justifications.A:
Accuracy of source data is a prerequisite for the quality of the data in a data warehouse. Inaccurate
source data will corrupt the integrity of the data in the data warehouse.
justifications.B:
Credibility of the data source is important but would not change inaccurate data into quality (accurate)
data.
justifications.C:
Accurate extraction processes are important but would not change inaccurate data into quality (accurate)
data.
justifications.D:
Accurate transformation routines are important but would not change inaccurate data into quality
(accurate) data.

questions.question:
A clerk changed the interest rate for a loan on a master file. The rate entered is outside the normal range for
such a loan. Which of the following controls is MOST effective in providing reasonable assurance that the
change was authorized?

options.A:
The system will not process the change until the clerk's manager confirms the change by entering an
approval code.
options.B:
The system generates a weekly report listing all rate exceptions and the report is reviewed by the clerk's
manager.
options.C: The system requires the clerk to enter an approval code.
options.D: The system displays a warning message to the clerk.

justifications.A:
Requiring an approval code by a manager prevents or detects the use of an unauthorized interest
rate.
justifications.B:
A weekly report informs the manager after the feet that a change was made, thereby making it possible
for transactions to use an unauthorized rate prior to management review. Although this control provides
visibility into rate exceptions, it does not prevent or enforce authorization in real time. By relying
solely on periodic review, there is no immediate assurance that the change was authorized before it was
processed.
justifications.C:
Having a clerk enter an approval code does not provide separation of duties and does not prevent the clerk
from entering an unauthorized rate change.
justifications.D:
A warning message alerts the clerk in case the change was being made in error but does not prevent the
clerk from entering an unauthorized rate change.
359
C/SA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question: The GREATEST advantage of using web services for the exchange of information between two systems is:

options.A: secure communication.
options.B: improved performance.
options.C: efficient interfacing.
options.D: enhanced documentation.

justifications.A: Communication is not necessarily more secure using web services.
justifications.B: The use of web services does not necessarily increase performance.
justifications.C:
Web services facilitate the interoperable exchange of information between two systems regardless of
the operating system or programming language used.
justifications.D: There is no documentation benefit in using web services.

questions.question: Which of the following is a prevalent risk in the development of end-user computing applications?

options.A: Applications may not be subject to testing and IT general controls.
options.B: Development and maintenance costs may be increased.
options.C: Application development time may be increased.
options.D: Decision-making may be impaired due to diminished responsiveness to requests for information.

justifications.A:
End-user computing is defined as the ability of end users to design and implement their own
information system using computer software products. End-user developed applications may
not be subjected to an independent outside review by systems analysts and frequently are
not created in the context of a formal development methodology. These applications may lack
appropriate standards, controls, quality assurance procedures and documentation. A risk of end­
user applications is that management may rely on them as much as traditional applications.
justifications.B: End-user computing systems typically result in reduced application development and maintenance costs.
justifications.C: End-user computing systems typically result in a reduced development cycle time.
justifications.D:
End-user computing systems normally increase flexibility and responsiveness to managemenfs
information requests because the system is being developed directly by the user community.
360 C/SA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor finds out-o仁range data in some tables of a database. Which of the
following controls should the IS auditor recommend to avoid this situation?

options.A: Log all table update transactions
options.B: Implement integrity constraints in the database
options.C: Implement before and after image reporting
options.D: Use tracing and tagging

justifications.A:
Logging all table update transactions provides audit trails and is a detective control but will not prevent
the introduction of inaccurate data.
justifications.B:
Implementing integrity constraints in the database is a preventive control because data are checked
against predefined tables or rules, which prevents any undefined data from being entered.
justifications.C:
Before and after image reporting makes it possible to trace the impact that transactions have on computer
records and is a detective control.
justifications.D:
Tracing and tagging is used to test application systems and controls but is not a preventive control that can
avoid out-of-range data.

questions.question:
Which of the following is the MOST effective when determining the correctness of individual account
balances migrated from one database to another?

options.A: Compare the hash total before and after the migration.
options.B: Verify that the number of records is the same fbr both databases.
options.C: Perform sample testing of the migrated account balances.
options.D: Compare the control totals of all of the transactions.

justifications.A: The hash total only validates the data integrity at a batch level rather than at a transaction level.
justifications.B:
Databases are composed of records that can contain multiple fields. The number of records does not allow
an information systems (IS) auditor to ascertain whether some of these fields have been successfully
migrated.
justifications.C:
Performing sample testing of the migrated account balances involves the comparison of a selection
of individual transactions from the database before and after the migration.
justifications.D:
Comparing the control totals does not imply that the records are complete or that individual values are
accurate.

questions.question:
During the review of data file change management controls, which of the following BEST helps to decrease
the research time needed to investigate exceptions?

options.A: One-fbr-one checking
options.B: Data file security
options.C: Transaction logs
options.D: File updating and maintenance authorization

justifications.A:
One-fbr-one checking is a control procedure in which an individual document agrees with a detailed
listing of documents processed by the system. It would take a long time to complete the research using
this procedure.
justifications.B:
Data file security controls prevent access by unauthorized users in their attempt to alter data files. This
would not help identify the transactions posted to an account.
justifications.C:
Transaction logs generate an audit trail by providing a detailed list of date of input, time of input,
user ID, terminal location, etc. Research time can be reduced in investigating exceptions because
the review can be performed on the logs rather than on the entire transaction file. Transaction
logs also help to determine which transactions have been posted to an account—by a particular
individual during a particular period.
justifications.D:
File updating and maintenance authorization is a control procedure to update the stored data and ensure
accuracy and security of stored data. This does provide evidence regarding the individuals who update
the stored data; however, it is not effective in the given situation to determine transactions posted to an
account.
362 CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is reviewing a monthly accounts payable transaction register using audit
software. Why would the auditor be interested in using a check digit?

options.A: To detect data transposition errors
options.B: To ensure that transactions do not exceed predetermined amounts
options.C: To ensure that data entered are within reasonable limits
options.D: To ensure that data entered are within a predetermined range of values

justifications.A:
A check digit is a numeric value added to data to ensure that original data are correct and have not
been altered.
justifications.B: Ensuring that data have not exceeded a predetermined amount is a limit check.
justifications.C: Ensuring that data entered are within predetermined reasonable limits is a reasonableness check.
justifications.D: Ensuring that data entered are within a predetermined range of values is a range check.

questions.question:
A hard disk containing confidential data was damaged beyond repair. If the goal is to ensure with certainty
that access to the data by anyone else is prevented, what should be done to the hard disk before it is discarded?

options.A: Overwriting
options.B: Low-level formatting
options.C: Degaussing
options.D: Destruction

justifications.A:
Rewriting data is impractical because the hard disk is damaged and offers less assurance than physical
destruction even when done successfully.
justifications.B:
Low-level formatting is impractical because the hard disk is damaged and offers less assurance than
physical destruction even when done successfully.
justifications.C: Degaussing is highly effective but offers less assurance than physical destruction.
justifications.D:
Physically destroying the hard disk is the most effective way to ensure that data cannot be
recovered.
