questions.question: Authorizing access to application data is the responsibility of the:

options.A: data custodian.
options.B: application administrator.
options.C: data owner.
options.D: security administrator.

justifications.A:
Data custodians are responsible only fbr storing and safeguarding the data according to the direction
provided by the data owner.
justifications.B:
An application administrator is responsible for managing the application itself not determining who is
authorized to access the data that it contains.
justifications.C:
Data owners have authority to grant or withhold access to the data and applications for which they
are responsible.
justifications.D:
The security administrator may lead investigations and is responsible fbr implementing and maintaining
information security policy, but not for authorizing data access.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor finds that a database administrator (DBA) has read-and-write access to
production data. The IS auditor should:

options.A: accept the DBA access as a common practice.
options.B: assess the controls relevant to the DBA function.
options.C: recommend the immediate revocation of the DBA access to production data.
options.D: review user access authorizations approved by the DBA.

justifications.A:
Although granting access to production data to the database administrator (DBA) may be a common
practice, the information systems (IS) auditor should evaluate the relevant controls.
justifications.B:
When reviewing privileged accounts, the auditor should look for compensating controls that may
address a potential exposure.
justifications.C:
The DBA should have access based on the principle of least privilege; unless care is taken to validate
what access is required, revocation may remove access positively at the DBA requires to do their job.
justifications.D:
Granting user authorizations is the responsibility of the data owner, not the DBA, and access to
production data is not generally associated with user access authorizations.

questions.question:
Which of the following is the MOST effective method for disposing of magnetic media that contains
confidential information?

options.A: Degaussing
options.B: Defragmenting
options.C: Erasing
options.D: Destroying

justifications.A:
Degaussing or demagnetizing is a good control, but not sufficient to fully erase highly confidential
information from magnetic media.
justifications.B:
The purpose of defragmentation is to improve efficiency by eliminating fragmentation in file systems; it
does not remove information.
justifications.C:
Erasing or deleting magnetic media does not remove the information; this method simply changes a file's
indexing information.
justifications.D:
Destroying magnetic media is the only way to assure that confidential information cannot be
recovered.

questions.question:
Which of the following should an information systems (IS) auditor recommend fbr the protection of specific
sensitive information stored in a data warehouse?

options.A: Implement column- and row-level permissions.
options.B: Enhance user authentication via strong passwords.
options.C: Organize the data warehouse into subject matter-specific databases.
options.D: Log user access to the data warehouse.

justifications.A:
Column- and row-level permissions control what information users can access. Column-level
security prevents users from seeing one or more attributes on a table. With row-level security,
a certain grouping of information on a table is restricted (e.g., if a table held details of employee
salaries, then a restriction can be put in place to ensure that, unless specifically authorized, users
cannot view the salaries of executive staff). Column- and row-level security can be achieved in
a relational database by allowing users to access logical representations of data (views) rather
than physical tables. This fine-grained security model is likely to offer the best balance between
information protection while still supporting a wide range of analytical and reporting uses.
justifications.B:
Enhancing user authentication via strong passwords is a security control that should apply to all users of
the data warehouse and does not specifically address protection of specific sensitive data.
justifications.C:
Organizing a data warehouse into subject-specific databases is a potentially useful practice but, alone,
does not adequately protect sensitive data. Database-level security is normally too coarse of a level
to efficiently and effectively protect information. For example, one database may hold information
that needs to be restricted, such as employee salary and customer profitability details, while other
information, such as employee department, may need to be legitimately accessed by a large number of
users. Organizing the data warehouse into subject-matter-specific databases is similar to user access in
that this control should generally apply. Extra attention can be devoted to reviewing access to tables with
sensitive data, but this control is not sufficient without strong preventive controls at the column and row
level.
justifications.D:
Logging user access is important, but it is only a detective control that does not provide adequate
protection to sensitive information.
365

questions.question: The responsibility fbr authorizing access to a business application system belongs to the:

options.A: data owner.
options.B: security administrator.
options.C: IT security manager.
options.D: requestor's immediate supervisor.

justifications.A:
When a business application is developed, a good practice is to assign an information or data
owner to the application. The information owner should be responsible for authorizing access to the
application itself or to back-end databases fbr queries.
justifications.B:
The security administrator normally does not have responsibility for authorizing access to business
applications.
justifications.C:
The IT security manager normally does not have responsibility fbr authorizing access to business
applications.
justifications.D:
The requestor's immediate supervisor may share the responsibility fbr approving user access to a business
application system; however, the final responsibility should go to the information owner.

questions.question:
What is the MOST effective control for enforcing accountability among database users who are accessing
sensitive information?

options.A: Implement a log management process.
options.B: Implement a two-foctor authentication.
options.C: Use table views to access sensitive data.
options.D: Separate database and application servers.

justifications.A:
Accountability means knowing what is being done by whom. The best way to enforce the principle
is to implement a log management process that creates and stores logs with pertinent information,
such as username, type of transaction and hour
justifications.B:
Implementing a two-factor authentication prevents unauthorized access to the database but does not
record the activity of the user when using the database.
justifications.C:
Using table views restricts users from seeing data that they should not be able to see but does not record
what users did with data that they were allowed to see.
justifications.D:
Separating database and application servers may help with better administration or even in implementing
access controls but does not address the accountability issues.

questions.question:
While auditing an ecommerce architecture, an information systems (IS) auditor notes that customer master
data are stored on the web server fbr six months after the transaction date and then purged due to inactivity.
Which of the following is the PRIMARY concern for the IS auditor?

options.A: Availability of customer data
options.B: Integrity of customer data
options.C: Confidentiality of customer data
options.D: System storage performance

justifications.A:
Availability of customer data may be affected during an Internet connection outage, but this is of a lower
concern than confidentiality.
justifications.B:
Integrity of customer data is affected only if security controls are weak enough to permit unauthorized
modifications to the data, and it may be tracked by logging of changes. Confidentiality of data is a larger
concern.
justifications.C:
Due to its exposure to the Internet, storing customer data for six months raises concerns regarding
confidentiality of customer data.
justifications.D:
System storage performance may be a concern due to the volume of data. However, the bigger issue is
that the information is protected.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is asked to audit the change management process fbr all IT operational
systems. Which of the following documents will BEST aid the auditor in defining the scope fbr the audit
project?

options.A: Enterprise architecture (EA)
options.B: Control catalog
options.C: Risk register
options.D: IT organizational chart

justifications.A:
The enterprise architecture (EA) document provides the IT-environment information that the
information systems (IS) auditor needs to be able to define the scope of the audit on the change
management process for all IT systems.
justifications.B:
The control catalog is required for an auditor to be able to plan the testing of controls, which is the next
step after defining scope.
justifications.C:
The risk register helps the IS auditor to determine the systems to audit, based on the priority of their
associated risk and is useful during audit planning but not in defining the scope of the audit.
justifications.D:
The IT organizational chart helps the IS auditor to understand the process flow, which is useful during
audit planning but is not the most helpful in defining the scope of the audit.
367

questions.question:
In a distributed system, which of the following BEST allows different components or modules to
communicate and coordinate their activities?

options.A: Message queue interface
options.B: Application programming interface (API)
options.C: Remote procedure call
options.D: Communication infrastructure interface

justifications.A:
A message queue interface is a specific type of interface that is used fbr asynchronous communication
between applications through message queues, but it is not a general-purpose interface fbr coordinating
activities in a distributed system.
justifications.B:
An application programming interface (API) allows components or modules in a distributed system
to communicate and coordinate their activities. An API defines a set of rules and protocols that
enable the interaction and exchange of data between software components.
justifications.C:
A Remote Procedure Call (RPC) is a communication protocol that allows a program to execute a
procedure or function in a different address space, but it is not specifically focused on coordinating
activities in a distributed system.
justifications.D:
Communication infrastructure interface is an interface between the application platform and the
communication infrastructure.

questions.question:
Which of the following allows software systems or applications to access and interact with a cloud-based
infrastructure or service provider?

options.A: Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP)
options.B: Remote procedure call
options.C: Circuit-level gateway
options.D: Application programming interface (API)

justifications.A:
Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) is a network management protocol used fbr monitoring
and managing network devices, but it is not designed specifically for accessing cloud-based infrastructure
or service providers.
justifications.B:
A Remote Procedure Call (RPC) is a communication protocol that allows a program to execute a
procedure or function in a different address space, but it is not designed specifically fbr accessing
cloud-based infrastructure or service providers.
justifications.C:
A circuit-level gateway is a telecommunication gateway fbr transferring data from different networks but
is not designed specifically for accessing cloud-based infrastructure or service providers.
justifications.D:
An application programming interface (API) allows software systems or applications to access and
interact with a cloud-based infrastructure or service provider. APIs provide a set of rules and
protocols that enable developers to integrate their applications with cloud services, access resources
and perform various operations.

questions.question: Which of the following is MOST useful for effective security log management?

options.A: Implementing automated tools to collect, analyze and retain logs
options.B: Archiving and storing logs indefinitely to ensure historical data availability
options.C: Collecting all logs from all systems, databases, devices and tools
options.D: Security manager reviewing logs daily to detect and respond to security incidents

justifications.A:
Effective security log management involves automated tools and processes to collect, analyze and
retain logs from various systems and devices within an organization's IT infrastructure. Automated
log management solutions help streamline the log collection process, centralize logs from different
sources, apply real-time analysis techniques to identify security incidents and retain logs for an
appropriate period based on regulatory and compliance requirements. Automated tools can process
large volumes of log data and identify abnormal patterns or suspicious activities that a human
analyst might miss. These tools can also generate alerts in real time when they detect potential
security incidents.
justifications.B:
Storing logs indefinitely is not feasible due to storage limitations and may not align with enterprise and
regulatory data retention policies.
justifications.C:
It is important to identify the types and nature of logs to be collected for analysis and from which systems,
databases, devices and tools they should be collected. All logs may not be collected.
justifications.D:
Having a security officer review logs daily may be tiresome, time-consuming and impractical for
enterprises with a large volume of logs. Automated systems may ease the work of detecting incidents.
369

questions.question:
Which of the following is a KEY benefit of using version control systems in configuration and release
management?

options.A: Manages complexity in code management
options.B: Eases collaboration with multiple developers
options.C: Limits accessibility for developers
options.D: Provides ability to track and revert changes

justifications.A:
Version control systems provide structure and organization to code repositories, making it easier to
manage changes, track versions and collaborate effectively; however, tracking changes is the key benefit
of using version control systems in configuration and release management.
justifications.B:
Version control systems facilitate collaboration among multiple developers by providing a centralized
platform for code sharing, version tracking and merging changes. They enable concurrent development,
branching and merging of code, enhancing collaboration rather than making it difficult. However, tracking
changes is essential in case of operational issues detected later.
justifications.C:
Version control systems offer access controls so developers cannot arbitrarily access code libraries and
make untraceable changes. It is complementary to tracking code changes.
justifications.D:
Using version control systems enables the tracking of code changes, including who made the
changes, when they were made and what modifications were implemented. This functionality allows
for easy identification of issues, collaboration among developers and the ability to revert to previous
versions if needed, promoting better configuration and release management

questions.question: Which of the following is a MAIN benefit of monitoring operational logs?

options.A: It provides early warnings of possible risk materialization.
options.B: It helps information systems (IS) auditors in detecting problems encountered during operations.
options.C: It gives insight into the health and performance of the IT infrastructure.
options.D: It provides audit trails fbr transactions processed during operations.

justifications.A:
Monitoring operational logs provides early warnings about possible risk materialization before it becomes
an incident; however, all operational logs do not provide such information.
justifications.B:
Auditors use sampling methods to review logs that are identified by certain criteria (e.g., operation
termination, login to sensitive accounts and transactions beyond defined thresholds). Monitoring such
operational logs helps in detecting problems in the identified area, but the logs are limited and provide
limited benefit.
justifications.C:
Operational log monitoring primarily helps in providing insight about the IT infrastructure and
provides data to build performance metrics for various IT resources (e.g., central processing unit
(CPU) performance, storage capacity usage, network bandwidth usage and maximum number of
transactions).
justifications.D:
Audit trails are more useful fbr ensuring appropriate processing of a transaction and they may not identify
problems in processing.

questions.question:
Which of the following BEST helps an information systems (IS) auditor in ensuring that automated data
conversion from an old system to a new system has been completed successfully?

options.A: Operator reports
options.B: Exception reports
options.C: Control totals
options.D: Application logs

justifications.A: Operator reports are manual logs of errors identified by the computer operator.
justifications.B:
Exception reports are automated reports that identify errors encountered during processing,
including transactions that are not converted automatically.
justifications.C:
Control totals help in ensuring that data has been converted completely but may not identify a specific
record that was not converted.
justifications.D:
Application logs provide errors encountered during application execution.

questions.question: An organization implemented an online customer help desk application using a software as a service (SaaS) operating model. An information systems (IS) auditor is asked to recommend the best control to monitor the service level agreement (SLA) with the SaaS vendor regarding availability. What is the BEST recommendation that the IS auditor can provide?

options.A: Ask the SaaS vendor to provide a weekly report on application uptime.
options.B: Implement an online polling tool to monitor the application and record outages.
options.C: Log all application outages reported by users and aggregate the outage time weekly.
options.D: Contract an independent third party to provide weekly reports on application uptime.

justifications.A: Weekly application availability reports are useful, but these reports represent only the vendor's perspective. While monitoring these reports, the organization can raise concerns of inaccuracy; however, without internal monitoring, such concerns cannot be substantiated.
justifications.B: Implementing an online polling tool to monitor and record application outages is the best option for an organization to monitor the software as a service application availability. Comparing internal reports with the vendor's service level agreement (SLA) reports ensures that the vendor's monitoring of the SLA is accurate and that all conflicts are appropriately resolved.
justifications.C: Logging the outage times reported by users is helpful but does not give a true picture of all outages of the online application. Some outages may go unreported, especially if the outages are intermittent.
justifications.D: Contracting a third party to implement availability monitoring is not a cost-effective option. Additionally, this results in a shift from monitoring the software as a service (SaaS) vendor to monitoring the third party.

questions.question: Applying a retention date on a file will ensure that:

options.A: data cannot be read until the date is set.
options.B: data will not be deleted before that date.
options.C: backup copies are not retained after that date.
options.D: datasets having the same name are differentiated.

justifications.A: The retention date does not affect the ability to read the file.
justifications.B: A retention date ensures that a file cannot be overwritten or deleted before that date has passed.
justifications.C: Backup copies would be expected to have a different retention date and, therefore, may be retained after the file has been overwritten.
justifications.D: The creation date, not the retention date, differentiates files with the same name.

questions.question: Which of the following is a MAJOR concern during a review of help desk activities?

options.A: The help desk team could not resolve certain calls.
options.B: A dedicated line is not assigned to the help desk team.
options.C: Resolved incidents are closed without reference to end users.
options.D: The help desk instant messaging has been down for more than six months.

justifications.A: Although this is of concern, it should be expected. A problem escalation procedure should be developed to handle such scenarios.
justifications.B: Ideally, a help desk team should have dedicated lines, but this exception is not as serious as the technical team unilaterally closing an incident.
justifications.C: The help desk function is a service-oriented unit. The end users must be advised before an incident can be regarded as closed.
justifications.D: Instant messaging is an add-on to improve the effectiveness of the help desk team. Its absence cannot be seen as a major concern if calls can still be made.

questions.question: The database administrator (DBA) suggests that database efficiency can be improved by denormalizing some tables. This will result in:

options.A: loss of confidentiality.
options.B: increased redundancy.
options.C: unauthorized accesses.
options.D: application malfunctions.

justifications.A: Denormalization should not cause loss of confidentiality even though confidential data may be involved. The database administrator (DBA) should ensure that access controls to the databases remain effective.
justifications.B: Normalization is a design or optimization process for a relational database that increases redundancy. Redundancy, which is usually considered positive for resource availability, is negative in a database environment because it demands additional and otherwise unnecessary data handling efforts. Denormalization is sometimes advisable for functional reasons.
justifications.C: Denormalization pertains to the structure of the database, not the access controls. It should not result in unauthorized access.
justifications.D: Denormalization may require some changes to the calls between databases and applications but should not cause application malfunctions.

questions.question: Which of the following tests performed by an information systems (IS) auditor is the MOST effective in determining compliance with organizational change control procedures?

options.A: Review software migration records and verify approvals.
options.B: Identify changes that have occurred and verify approvals.
options.C: Review change control documentation and verify approvals.
options.D: Ensure that only appropriate staff can migrate changes into production.

justifications.A: Software migration records may not have all changes listed—changes could have been made that were not included in the migration records.
justifications.B: The most effective method is to determine what changes have been made (check logs and modified dates) and then verify that they have been approved.
justifications.C: Change control records may not have all changes listed.
justifications.D: Ensuring that only appropriate staff can migrate changes into production is a key control process but, alone, does not verify compliance.

questions.question: A programmer maliciously modified a production program to change data and then restored the program back to the original code. Which of the following would MOST effectively detect the malicious activity?

options.A: Comparing source code
options.B: Reviewing system log files
options.C: Comparing object code
options.D: Reviewing executable and source code integrity

justifications.A: Source code comparisons are ineffective because the original programs were restored, and the changed program does not exist.
justifications.B: Reviewing system log files is the only trail that may provide information about unauthorized activities in the production library.
justifications.C: Object code comparisons are ineffective because the original programs were restored, and the changed program does not exist.
justifications.D: Reviewing executable and source code integrity is an ineffective control, because the source code was changed back to the original and will agree with the current executable.

questions.question: Which of the following should the information systems (IS) auditor review to ensure that servers are optimally configured to support processing requirements?

options.A: Benchmark test results
options.B: Server logs
options.C: Downtime reports
options.D: Server utilization data

justifications.A: Benchmark tests are designed to compare system performance using standardized criteria; however, benchmark testing does not provide the best data to ensure the optimal configuration of servers in an organization.
justifications.B: A server log contains data showing activities performed on the server but does not contain the utilization data required to ensure the optimal configuration of servers.
justifications.C: A downtime report identifies the elapsed time when a computer is not operating correctly because of machine failure but is not useful in determining optimal server configurations.
justifications.D: Monitoring server utilization identifies underused servers and monitors overall server utilization. Underused servers do not provide the business with optimal cost-effectiveness. By monitoring server usage, IT management can take appropriate measures to raise the utilization ratio and provide the most effective return on investment.

questions.question: In which of the following situations is it MOST appropriate to implement data mirroring as the recovery strategy?

options.A: Disaster tolerance is high.
options.B: The recovery time objective (RTO) is high.
options.C: The recovery point objective (RPO) is low.
options.D: The RPO is high.

justifications.A: Data mirroring is a data recovery technique, and disaster tolerance addresses the allowable time for an outage of the business.
justifications.B: The recovery time objective (RTO) is an indicator of disaster tolerance. Data mirroring addresses data loss, not the RTO.
justifications.C: The recovery point objective (RPO) indicates the latest point in time at which it is possible to recover the data. This determines how often the data must be backed up to minimize data loss. If the RPO is low, then the organization does not want to lose much data and must use a process such as data mirroring to prevent data loss.
justifications.D: If the RPO is high, then a less expensive backup strategy can be used; data mirroring should not be implemented as the data recovery strategy.

questions.question: The PRIMARY objective of testing a business continuity plan (BCP) is to:

options.A: familiarize employees with the business continuity plan (BCP).
options.B: ensure that all residual risk is addressed.
options.C: exercise all possible disaster scenarios.
options.D: identify limitations of the BCP.

justifications.A: Familiarizing employees with the business continuity plan (BCP) is a secondary benefit of a test.
justifications.B: It is not cost-effective to address all residual risk in a BCP.
justifications.C: It is not practical to test all possible disaster scenarios.
justifications.D: Testing the BCP provides the best evidence of any limitations that may exist.

questions.question: An information systems (IS) auditor finds that the data warehouse query performance decreases significantly at certain times of the day. Which of the following controls are MOST relevant for the IS auditor to review?

options.A: Permanent table-space allocation
options.B: Commitment and rollback controls
options.C: User spool and database limit controls
options.D: Read/write access log controls

justifications.A: Table-space allocation does not affect performance at different times of the day.
justifications.B: Commitment and rollback only apply to errors or failures and will not affect performance at different times of the day.
justifications.C: User spool limits restrict the space available for running user queries. This prevents poorly formed queries from consuming excessive system resources and impacting general query performance. Limiting the space available to users in their own databases prevents them from building excessively large tables. This helps to control space utilization, which itself acts to help performance by maintaining a buffer between the actual data volume stored and the physical device capacity. Additionally, it prevents users from consuming excessive resources in ad hoc table builds (as opposed to scheduled production loads that often can run overnight and are optimized for performance purposes). In a data warehouse, because online transactions are not being run, commitment and rollback does not have an impact on performance.
justifications.D: Read/write access log controls do not affect performance at different times of the day.

questions.question: What is the GREATEST risk associated with inadequate management of storage growth in a critical file server?

options.A: Backup time steadily increases.
options.B: Backup operational costs significantly increase.
options.C: Storage operational costs significantly increase.
options.D: Server recovery work may not meet the recovery time objective (RTO).

justifications.A: Backup time may increase, but that can be managed. The most important issue is the time taken to recover the data.
justifications.B: The backup cost issues are not as significant as not meeting the recovery time objective (RTO).
justifications.C: The storage cost issues are not as significant as not meeting the RTO.
justifications.D: In case of a crash, recovering a server with an extensive amount of data can require a significant amount of time. If the recovery cannot meet the RTO, there will be a discrepancy in IT strategies. It is important to ensure that server restoration can meet the RTO.

questions.question: An information systems (IS) auditor is conducting a review of the disaster recovery procedures for a data center. Which of the following indicators BEST shows that the procedures meet the requirements?

options.A: Documented procedures were approved by management.
options.B: Procedures were reviewed and compared with industry good practices.
options.C: A tabletop exercise using the procedures was conducted.
options.D: Recovery teams and their responsibilities are documented.

justifications.A: Management approval does not necessarily mean that the disaster recovery procedures are sufficient to meet the needs of the business.
justifications.B: Although it is useful to compare the procedures with documented industry good practices, a tabletop exercise (paper test) is a better indicator that the procedures meet requirements.
justifications.C: Conducting a tabletop exercise (paper-based test) of the procedures with all responsible members best ensures that the procedures meet the requirements. This type of test can identify missing or incorrect procedures because representatives responsible for performing the tasks are present.
justifications.D: The documentation of recovery teams and their responsibilities is part of the procedures and does not necessarily validate that the procedures are correct and complete thus meeting requirements.

questions.question: The cost of ongoing operations when a disaster recovery plan (DRP) is in place, compared to not having a DRP, will MOST likely:

options.A: increase.
options.B: decrease.
options.C: remain the same.
options.D: be unpredictable.

justifications.A: Due to the additional cost of testing, maintaining and implementing disaster recovery plan (DRP) measures, the cost of normal operations for any organization will always increase after a DRP implementation (i.e., the cost of normal operations during a nondisaster period is more than the cost of operations during a nondisaster period when no DRP was in place).
justifications.B: The implementation of a DRP always results in additional costs to the organization.
justifications.C: The implementation of a DRP always results in additional costs to the organization.
justifications.D: The costs of a DRP are fairly predictable and consistent.

questions.question: The PRIMARY objective of business continuity and disaster recovery plans should be to:

options.A: safeguard critical information systems (IS) assets.
options.B: provide for continuity of operations.
options.C: minimize the loss to an organization.
options.D: protect human life.

justifications.A: Safeguarding critical information systems (IS) assets is a secondary objective of a business continuity and disaster recovery plan. The first priority is always life safety.
justifications.B: Providing continuity of operations is a secondary objective of a business continuity and disaster recovery plan. The first priority is always life safety.
justifications.C: Minimizing the loss to an organization is a secondary objective of a business continuity and disaster recovery plan. The first priority is always life safety.
justifications.D: Because human life is invaluable, the main priority of any business continuity and disaster recovery plan should be to protect people.

questions.question: A new database is being set up in an overseas location to provide information to the general public and to increase the speed at which the information is made available. The overseas database is to be housed at a data center and will be updated in real time to mirror the information stored locally. Which of the following areas of operations should be considered as having the HIGHEST risk?

options.A: Confidentiality of the information stored in the database
options.B: The hardware being used to run the database application
options.C: Backups of the information in the overseas database
options.D: Remote access to the backup database

justifications.A: Confidentiality of the information stored in the database is not a major concern, because the information is intended for public use.
justifications.B: The business objective is to make the information available to the public in a timely manner. Because the database is physically located overseas, hardware failures that are left unfixed can reduce the availability of the system to users.
justifications.C: Backups of the information in the overseas database are not a major concern, because the overseas database is a mirror of the local database; thus, a backup copy exists locally.
justifications.D: Remote access to the backup database does not impact availability.

questions.question: Which interface allows different software applications to access and manipulate a relational database management system (RDBMS)?

options.A: Application programming interface (API)
options.B: Structured query language (SQL)
options.C: Object-relational mapping
options.D: Java database connectivity

justifications.A: An application programming interface (API) allows different software applications to access and manipulate a relational database management system (RDBMS). The API provides a set of functions, methods or protocols that enable developers to interact with the database, perform queries and manage data.
justifications.B: Structured Query Language (SQL) is a programming language specifically designed for managing and manipulating relational databases, but it is not an interface. SQL is typically used with an API to interact with the database.
justifications.C: Object-relational mapping is a technique that allows developers to map between objects in an application and relational database tables, but it is not an interface for accessing the RDBMS.
justifications.D: Java database connectivity is a Java API that provides methods for connecting to and interacting with a database using the Java programming language, but it is specific to Java and not a general-purpose interface.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST helps an information systems (IS) auditor to detect the problems encountered by application executions during IT operations?

options.A: Operating system logs
options.B: Incident reports
options.C: Exception reports
options.D: Computer operator logs

justifications.A: Operating system logs help in identifying problems encountered by operating systems and may not report application-related problems.
justifications.B: Application execution problems may not be reported as incidents and would not appear in incident reports unless the interruption is significant enough to be considered an incident.
justifications.C: Exception reports are automated reports that list the problems encountered by the application during execution.
justifications.D: Computer operator logs are manually entered by the operator during operations; these logs may or may not identify specific problems with applications.

questions.question: Which of the following is a MAJOR challenge in implementing a log management system?

options.A: Complexity of the IT infrastructure
options.B: Multiple formats of logs collected
options.C: Cost of storage due to the volume of logs
options.D: Addressing false-positive alerts

justifications.A:
Addressing the complexity of the IT resources that generate logs is a major challenge because the
performance of many resources deteriorates when logging is enabled. Therefore, it is necessary to
determine the type of logs to be captured from each resource.
justifications.B:
The multiplicity of log formats can be challenging; however, this can be addressed using appropriate
parsing techniques.
justifications.C:
Storage cost is a comparatively lesser challenge and can be managed with appropriate budget and
retention periods.
justifications.D:
Addressing false positives during the initial periods of implementation can be addressed by appropriate
planning and implementing tools in a phased manner.
